properties.areaDesc: Bullitt, KY; Spencer, KY; Floyd, IN; Oldham, KY; Hardin, KY; Jefferson, KY; Harrison, IN; Meade, KY; Shelby, KY
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 5:54PM EST until February 12 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Louisville KY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a

* Flood Advisory for Minor Flooding in Poor Drainage Areas for...
Southern Harrison County in south central Indiana...
Southern Floyd County in south central Indiana...
Northwestern Spencer County in central Kentucky...
Oldham County in central Kentucky...
Northwestern Shelby County in central Kentucky...
Meade County in central Kentucky...
Jefferson County in central Kentucky...
North central Hardin County in central Kentucky...
Bullitt County in central Kentucky...

* Until 900 PM EST.

* At 553 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
heavy rain which could cause minor flooding. Overflowing poor
drainage areas will result in minor flooding in the advisory area.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Louisville, Jeffersonville, New Albany, Jeffersontown, St.
Matthews, Shively, Shepherdsville, Lyndon, La Grange and
Middletown.

Should heavier rain rates persist...a flash flood warning may be
required over the next couple of hours. Stay tuned for updates.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is
harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
